column4: Nautilus expects higher sales as COVID-19 drives exercise equipment boom
column5: (Reuters) - Nautilus Inc NLS.N on Wednesday forecast higher sales for the first quarter, as the coronavirus-driven stay-at-home boosted demand for its exercise equipment.
column6: Shares of the company, which competes with Peloton Interactive Inc PTON.O, surged 30% in extended trading.
column7: Nautilus said it expects first-quarter net sales to rise 11% from a year earlier to $94 million, the first increase in more than a year, as people turn to at-home exercise equipment because of restrictions on movement.
column8: “Demand for many of our home-fitness products continues to outpace supply and we are pulling all levers to accelerate the manufacturing and delivery of key products,” Chief Executive Officer Jim Barr said. [nBwb6bh9ka]
column9: The company said it expects its retail segment to grow 24% in the quarter as e-commerce sales and curbside pick-up facilities outweigh the impact of stores being shut.
column10: Factory workers in China, where a significant volume of Nautilus’ products are manufactured, and the coronavirus originated, have returned to work and transportation from the country is improving, the company said.
column11: It added it now expects earnings before interest, tax, deprecation and amortization for the quarter to be between break even and $1.5 million.
column12: Striking a cautious note, Barr said “the coming quarters may present added challenges for all businesses as we better understand the longer-term impacts of COVID-19.”

column4: BRIEF-Nautilus Says Most Workers In Factories In China That Co Utilizes Have Returned To Work

column9: * SHORT-TERM, IT MAY REMAIN A SIGNIFICANT CHALLENGE TO FULLY MATCH UNPLANNED SURGE IN DEMAND WITH SUPPLY
